channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: Scope3：デジタル広告が生み出すCO2排出量は年間720万トンで、これは米国の一般家庭140万戸分の電気使用量に相当する（Tim McDonnell/Semafor）
item.description:
Tim McDonnell / Semafor:
Advertisers face growing pressure to cut their emissions; Scope3: digital ads create ~7.2M tons of CO2 annually, equivalent to 1.4M US homes' electricity usage  —  The News  —  Of all the sectors under pressure to cut their carbon footprint, advertising has largely flown under the radar.

item.title: インディペンデンス・パブリック・メディア財団のモリー・デ・アギアー理事長とのQ&A：地元メディアの資金提供者と国の資金提供者との間にしばしば生じる断絶などについて（Richard J. Tofel/Second Rough Draft）
item.description:
Richard J. Tofel / Second Rough Draft:
Q&A with Independence Public Media Foundation President Molly de Aguiar on the frequent disconnect between local media funders and national funders, and more  —  Molly de Aguiar on a key goal of plans like Press Forward … Q. I think we agree that the only way to really sustainably achieve …

item.title: フランスの日曜紙「ラ・トリビューヌ・ディマンシュ」創刊の様子。唯一の日曜紙「ル・ジャーナル・デュ・ディマンシュ」が極右新聞に変貌する中（Angelique Chrisafis/The Guardian）
item.description:
Angelique Chrisafis / The Guardian:
A look at the launch of the French Sunday newspaper La Tribune Dimanche, as the only other Sunday paper, Le Journal du Dimanche, turns into a far-right outlet  —  La Tribune Dimanche goes on sale in landscape of declining print sales, culture wars and scrutiny of billionaire proprietors

item.title: 情報源フロリダ政治』創刊者ピーター・ショーシュ氏、政治家に無記名記事を買わせ、広告を買う政治キャンペーンの意向で報道を歪曲（NPR）
item.description:
NPR:
Sources: Florida Politics founder Peter Schorsch lets politicians buy unlabeled stories and distorts coverage at the behest of political campaigns that buy ads  —  This story was reported by NPR's David Folkenflik and Miranda Green of Floodlight, a nonprofit newsroom that investigates the powerful interests stalling climate action.

item.title: アレクサは2020年のアメリカ大統領選挙が盗まれたと主張し、信頼できないランブルとサブスタックの情報源を引用していたが、アマゾンは誤りを修正したと述べている（Cat Zakrzewski/Washington Post）
item.description:
Cat Zakrzewski / Washington Post:
Alexa has been claiming that the US 2020 presidential election was stolen, citing unvetted Rumble and Substack sources; Amazon says the errors have been fixed  —  The popular voice assistant says the 2020 race was stolen, even as parent company Amazon promotes the tool as a reliable election news source …

item.title: ニューヨーク・パブリック・ラジオが20人のスタッフを解雇、スタジオ部門から2つのポッドキャストをカット。
item.description:
Max Rivlin-Nadler / hellgatenyc:
New York Public Radio lays off 20 staff members and cuts two podcasts from its studio division; three more employees took union-negotiated voluntary buyouts  —  “It is not a good use of any of our time, looking in the rearview mirror and trying to figure out where we should place blame,” …

item.title: BBCはOpenAIとCommon Crawlによるデータのスクレイピングをブロックしているが、研究、制作、パーソナライズされた体験のためのジェネレーティブAIの利用を模索する計画だ（Emilia David/The Verge）
item.description:
Emilia David / The Verge:
The BBC blocks OpenAI and Common Crawl from scraping its data, but plans to explore using generative AI for research, production, and personalized experiences  —  The BBC, the UK's largest news organization, laid out principles it plans to follow as it evaluates the use of generative AI …

item.title: アライアンス・バーンスタインNetflixはインドで650万人、Prime Videoは2,000万人、Disney+ Hotstarは4,000万人以上、Netflixの成長が遅いのはローカルコンテンツが12%しかないため（Manish Singh/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Manish Singh / TechCrunch:
AllianceBernstein: Netflix has ~6.5M subs in India, Prime Video has 20M, Disney+ Hotstar has 40M+; Netflix's slow growth is due to having just 12% local content  —  Netflix has “not succeeded” in scaling up its business in India despite the global streaming giant consistently lowering …

item.title: 情報筋ディズニーは、ゴータム・アダニ氏や放送会社サンテレビの会長カラニティ・マラン氏を含む、インド資産の買収候補者と交渉中。
item.description:
Bloomberg:
Sources: Disney is in talks with potential acquirers for its Indian assets, including Gautam Adani and Kalanithi Maran, the chair of broadcasting company Sun TV  —  - US group weighing outright sale, joint venture, other options  — Early discussions have also been held with Ambani's Reliance

item.title: デリー警察、シャオミやビボなどを非難 中国のプロパガンダを広めたとしてインドが非難したニュース配信会社ニューズクリックへの違法送金に協力（ロイター）
item.description:
Reuters:
Delhi police accuse Xiaomi, Vivo, and others of helping transfer funds illegally to news outlet NewsClick, which India accused of spreading Chinese propaganda  —  Indian police have formally accused Chinese smartphone makers Xiaomi Corp and Vivo Mobile of helping transfer funds illegally …

item.title: 獄中のイラン人ジャーナリストで人権活動家のナルゲス・モハマディ氏が、イランにおける女性抑圧との闘いで2023年のノーベル平和賞を受賞（Fatima Al-Kassab/NPR）
item.description:
Fatima Al-Kassab / NPR:
Jailed Iranian journalist and human rights activist Narges Mohammadi wins the 2023 Nobel Peace Prize for her fight against the oppression of women in Iran  —  This year's Nobel Peace Prize has been awarded to Iranian human rights activist and journalist Narges Mohammadi.

item.title: ピッツバーグの新聞社社員が、ブロック・コミュニケーションズ傘下のピッツバーグ・ポスト・ガゼット紙とのストライキ1周年を記念して集会を開いた（Tori Yorgey/WTAE）
item.description:
Tori Yorgey / WTAE:
Pittsburgh newspaper employees rally to mark the one-year anniversary of their ongoing strike against Block Communications' Pittsburgh Post-Gazette  —  Rally to be held Friday afternoon  —  Friday marked one year since workers at the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette walked out of their workplace and onto the picket line.

item.title: ネバダ州最高裁は、殺害されたジェフ・ジャーマン記者の端末を警察の捜査から保護し、第三者が彼の報道資料を捜査するよう求めた（Katelyn Newberg/Las Vegas Review-Journal）
item.description:
Katelyn Newberg / Las Vegas Review-Journal:
The Nevada Supreme Court protects murdered reporter Jeff German's devices from police searches, calling for a third party to search his journalistic materials  —  The Nevada Supreme Court has moved to protect slain Las Vegas Review-Journal investigative reporter Jeff German's personal devices …

item.title: カナダの遺産相、オンラインニュース法に反対する大企業にもかかわらず「引き下がらない」と発言；グーグルは「重大な構造的問題」が残っていると発言（フランス通信社）
item.description:
Agence France-Presse:
Canada's heritage minister says the country “will not back down” despite Big Tech opposing the Online News Act; Google says “critical structural issues” remain  —  Canada “will not back down” in the face of opposition from tech giants to a new law requiring companies …

item.title: 超法規的殺人を擁護するなど、ドナルド・トランプの攻撃的な言葉はほとんど注目されない。
item.description:
Paul Farhi / Washington Post:
Donald Trump's increasingly aggressive words, like advocating for extrajudicial killings, get little attention, as the media still doesn't know how to cover him  —  After eight years of Trump in politics, is a ‘banality of crazy’ setting in?  —  Last week, the Republican Party's leading …
